head.title: MP3.COM STOCK SOARS ON SONY SETTLEMENT

hedline.hl1: MP3.COM STOCK SOARS ON SONY SETTLEMENT

abstract.p: Shares of MP3.com, online music seller, rise 20.6 percent, up $1.59, to $9.34, on news it settled copyright infringement lawsuit brought by Sony's music unit; settlement gives company deals with four of five major record labels; deal calls for MP3.com to pay Sony undisclosed amount for past copyright violations (S)

block.p: Shares of MP3.com, an online music seller, rose 20.6 percent, up $1.59, to $9.34, on news it settled a copyright infringement lawsuit brought by Sony's music unit. The settlement gives the company deals with four of the five major record labels. The deal calls for MP3.com to pay Sony an undisclosed amount for past copyright violations. MP3.com will be able to offer Sony recordings on its My.MP3.com system. The company has settled with EMI, the Warner Music Group of Time Warner and the BMG Entertainment unit of Bertelsmann, but has yet to settle with the Universal Music Group of Seagram.
